entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 6:41AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong East Winds and Blowing Snow Friday and This Weekend... Easterly winds are expected to increase to 35 mph on Friday, and to 60 mph over the weekend. This will cause blowing snow to develop Friday, with blizzard conditions possible over the weekend. The strongest winds and lowest visibility are expected from Prudhoe Bay east late Friday night through Sunday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 10:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY COLD TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS THIS WEEK... The first significant outflow event of this Winter season has begun for Southeast Alaska. Overnight lows will decrease with each passing night through at least Thursday night.
